intro: Jacquemontia elongata, commonly known as the elongated morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to purple blooms that open in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Jacquemontia elongata is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and thickets.
